alert.note: Alert for Far South Miami-Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 3:35PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Mainland Monroe and central Miami-Dade Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 335 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud near Everglades National Park, or 16 miles west of Homestead General Airport, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Homestead General Airport, The Redland, Shark Valley Obs Tower, Everglades National Park and Pa-Hay-Okee Overlook. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows.

area.areaDesc: Far South Miami-Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe
